properties.name: BREAKFAST: Andy's Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Weave  29556 Orchard Lake Road, Farmington Hills, MIRun by a former head chef from Yugoslavia, and his wife, Andy\'s is always packed with weekend morning diners looking for a fantastic breakfast. The line usually stretches out the door, and it\'s WORTH IT. Try his homemade pastries, which he used to win awards for in Yugoslavia.

properties.name: Castlemaine
properties.description: Posted by WeaveCastlemaine, Kerry, IrelandI was jet-lagged as hell, driving my little Toyota on the "wrong" side of the road, sitting on the "wrong" side of the car...and it was a stick. Utterly exhausted, I came around a blind corner, tried to downshift and stalled the car. As I sat in the middle of Castlemaine\'s town square, engine turning over, a petrol tanker came flying around the corner far above the speed limit, headed right for me. He slammed on his breaks, and just before the truck hit me, I managed to pop it into gear and peel out, squealing tires from both vehicles echoing throughout the village. My second near-death experience in Ireland...my favorite country on Earth.

properties.name: DINNER: Metropolitan Grill
properties.description: Posted by Weave820 2nd Ave, Seattle, WAI\'ve dined at Morton\'s in LA and Chicago...this is hands-down my favorite restaurant for a huge, juicy steak. The exquisite taste will blow you away. Afterward, enjoy cigars and martinis at the bar.

properties.name: GAME: Hudson's on the Bend
properties.description: Posted by Weave 3509 FM 620 Rd N, Austin, TXA Lake Country game restaurant, Hudson\'s features venison, wild boar, pheasant, quail along with traditional meat dishes like trout, Black Angus Beef and Smoked Lobster. Never had gourmet game before. All I can say is Oh. My. God.

properties.name: INDIAN: Swami's Mayura
properties.description: Posted by Weave 3201 Jefferson Avenue, Cincinnati, OHKalayan Swami Naidu Sunkara, known as Swami, is a favorite among celebs, who always seem to frequent his restaurant when they come to Cincinnati. His very friendly demeanor and lavish attention can make the timid a little stand-offish, but his food is the best Indian cuisine I\'ve had anywhere in the US or the EU.

properties.name: IRISH BREAKFAST: Ballinalacken Castle Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Weave Roadford, Co. Clare, IrelandIf you can get the room facing the Atlantic, with the fireplace and big canopy bed, you\'ll be in an Irish faerie tale fer sure. The breakfast, unlike so many Irish hotels and B&Bs, was cooked very well indeed, and the view was grand. If you\'re lucky, the proprietor will let you explore the locked castle the next morning.

properties.name: ITALIAN: Sesto Senso
properties.description: Posted by Weave  1214 18th St NW, Washington, DCA classic thumping DC euro-club at night, Sesto is a very warm, cosmopolitan Italian restaurant. Fantastic service and lots of amazing scenery, it\'s my choice for Best Italian. And yes, it blows away Alfredo\'s in NYC.

properties.name: Innsbruck
properties.description: Posted by WeaveInnsbruck, AustriaIn high school, my friends and I went to the old town square in downtown Innsbruck, Austria, where we got out at the horse trough from 1500 or whatever it was, got water from the well, and created a 16-person outdoor fountain, spitting water with our mouths. You, umm, had to see it to believe it. Needless to say, we had traffic stopped in ths Tyrolean city. Crazy Yanks! The year was 1978.

properties.name: Off Napili Bay, Maui, Hawai'i, USA
properties.description: Posted by Weavemaui, hawaii, usaWhen I was a child, I nearly drowned at age 1 and again at 8. Both times I was pulled from the water unconscious, so for many years I was very uncomfortable in water over my head. On my honeymoon, I decided I was going to go snorkelling. My wife and a friend and I swam out about a half-mile into the Pacific to snorkel over a reef. I noticed, at first with nervousness, and later with alarm, that the sharp rocks of the reef were coming within inches of my stomach. I also noticed I was so out of breath that I started hyperventilating. I couldn\'t go vertical to get my head above water because of the rocks, and then, of course, I lost a fin. Now I was REALLY starting to panic. Despite this panic and having to be towe back to shore by my bride and friend, I vowed I\'d return and was snorkelling in far deeper water within a couple of days.

properties.name: ROMANTIC: The Celestial
properties.description: Posted by Weave1071 Celestial St, Cincinnati, OHAmazing view, award-winning wines and Most Romantic Restaurant as voted by the New York Times and Cincinnati Magazine.

properties.name: Salt Creek Grille
properties.description: Posted by Weave 32802 Pacific Coast Highway, Dana Point, CAEnjoy a cocktail around the outdoor fire pit and then go inside for an amazing mesquite steak. Afterward, walk down to Salt Creek Beach...my idea of a memorable California evening!

properties.name: The Clan Campbell of Breadalbane, 1650
properties.description: Posted by WeaveAye, the Clan Campbell of Breadalbane, what\'s it to ye? My forebear is Colin Campbell, clan chieftain.

properties.name: The Cliffs at Dunmore Point
properties.description: Posted by WeaveAfter many years of disinterest by my ex, and my subsequent divorce, I fell in love with a beautiful woman who breathed life into my soul. She was like water to a dying man. Two years into our relationship, she died in a plane crash, shortly before our scheduled trip to Ireland. Completely distraught and beyond anguish, I sat here on the cliffs 200ft above the rocky ocean shore. Two things suddenly happened: I began to remember, in extreme detail, our every moment together, things I\'d long forgotten, smells, places and her words to me. And then, clearly, I could HEAR HER VOICE above the crashing of the waves, calling to me. For four hours or so, I sat staring at the rocks below, wind gusts pushing me forward and back, thinking that if I jumped, I\'d see her much sooner. And that felt like a really, REALLY good idea. But after considering my children and what their life would be like without me, I reluctantly climbed back down to start a new life without her in this new parallel universe in which she was dead and I\'d never see her again.

properties.name: The Hughes Family, 1850
properties.description: Posted by Weave Dublin, IrelandEmigrants from Ireland gave me my high-tolerance liver and my sarcastic, joking outlook on life.

properties.name: The Itoman Family, 1900
properties.description: Posted by Weave Japanese fisherman also feature prominently in my family history...

properties.name: The Thompson Family, 1860
properties.description: Posted by Weave Somerby, Leicestershire, EnglandYou know you\'re English when one of your ancestors is named Thomas Thompson.

properties.name: The Waber Family, 1600
properties.description: Posted by Weave oberdorfThe village of Oberdorf in Canton Basel is a tiny town of 3,000, nestled high in a mountain valley. It was here in the 1600s that one of my great-great-great-great-...-grandfathers lived about 15 miles from one of the great-great-great-great-...-grandmothers of my wife. So 400 years after they both left this valley, their descendents found and married one another, quite by random chance.

properties.name: WESTERN: Wolf Lodge Inn
properties.description: Posted by Weave 12025 E Frontage Road, Coeur d\'Alene, IDFrom RoadFood.com: "A vast red barn-board roadhouse just yards from the highway, The Wolf Lodge Inn is an exuberant wild-west domain. Tables are covered with oilcloth and the walls are packed with trophy animal heads, bleached bovine skulls, antique tools, old beer posters, and yellowing newspaper clippings of local-interest stories. Miscellaneous booths and dining nooks are arrayed in several rooms; at the back of the rearmost dining area is a stone barbecue pit where tamarack and cherrywood burn a few feet below the grate. On this grate sizzle slabs of beef ranging from sixteen-ounce sirloins and filets mignon to porterhouses well over two pounds." From the Splendid Table radio show: "Wolf Lodge Inn is the kind of place Grizzly Adams would take a date. Wonderful salmon and steaks grilled over cherry wood are featured at this roadhouse on Lake Coeur d\'Alene. Expect gigantic portions (how about the 42-ounce Rancher Steak?) accompanied by Buckaroo Beans and the Inn\'s take on fry bread."
